docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 2--The British cruisers Ajax and Achilles will arrive simultaneously at noon tomorrow in Montevideo, Uruguay, and Buenos Aires, respectively, for forty-eight hour visits. These will be in the nature of a celebration of their victory over the ...
docs.abstract: crews of Brit cruisers Ajax and Achilles to visit Montevideo and Buenos Aires for 48-hr visits; Tacoma guarded; Uruguay turns over to police case against Ital paper Sequilla which criticized Govt's action against Spee

headline.main: AJAX AND ACHILLES GET PORT PERMITS; Crews to Land Today in Buenos Aires and Montevideo for 48 Hours' Shore Leave

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 3--The British cruisers Ajax and Achilles, which with the Exeter defeated the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee, put into Montevideo and Buenos Aires today for forty-eight hour visits.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 3--The British cruisers Ajax and Achilles, which with the Exeter defeated the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee, put into Montevideo and Buenos Aires today for forty-eight hour visits.
docs.abstract: Ajax and Achilles put into harbors; get popular welcome; Rear Adm Sir H H Harwood issues statement on Spee battle

headline.main: VICTORS OVER SPEE GET WILD WELCOME; Crowds in Montevideo Greet Ajax While Buenos Aires Hails the Achilles NEW STORY OF FIGHT TOLD Foe Fled in 16 Minutes, Says British Admiral--Most of Battle 250 Miles at Sea

docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Myron C. Taylor is giving a tea dance this afternoon at her home, 16 East Seventieth Street. Mrs. F. Dewey Everett will give a luncheon today in the Persian Room of the Plaza for Miss Eleanor McWilliam, debutante daughter of Mrs. Nash McWilliam.

docs.snippet: F. Luis Mora, painter, illustratar and etcher, whose work hangs in the White House and in many public buildings and art museums throughout the country, died yesterday at his home, 160 East Seventy-second Street, after a short illness. He was 65 years...
docs.lead_paragraph: F. Luis Mora, painter, illustratar and etcher, whose work hangs in the White House and in many public buildings and art museums throughout the country, died yesterday at his home, 160 East Seventy-second Street, after a short illness. He was 65 years old.

headline.main: F. LUIS MORA, 65, A NOTED PAINTER; Portrait of Harding Hung in White House--Artist Dies in His Home Here KNOWN FOR HIS MURALS Pictures Appear in Museums of U.S. and Canada--He Received Many Honors
